function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'main'?
loop_reachability: Can the loop with condition 'i < N' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'i < N' always executed?
Can the loop with condition 'j < N' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'j < N' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i < N' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'j < N' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Is variable 'argc' used after its definition?
Does the value assigned to 'argv' affect subsequent computations?
liveness: Does variable 'k' remain in use at the end of function 'main'?
Is variable 'argc' live at the end of function 'main'?
dead_code: Can the program actually reach the statement: “for (int k = 0; k < N; ++k)”?
